On several occasions during the past few years, and on the 10th September last, the Imperial ConsulConsul General at Calcutta has notified to the Gov ernment of India the appointments of various officers of the German army to he 'Attaches' to the Consulate General, and such notifications have naturally, as a matter of courtesy, been duly acknowledged by the foreign department of that Government. titleInfo.title: File 868/1904 Pt 7 'Consular: Germany; appointment of military officers as attaches to their Consulates in India'

mods.abstract: Part 7 contains correspondence and telegrams between the German Consulate General at Calcutta, the German Embassy in London, the Foreign Office and the India Office, regarding issues with the recognition of members of staff at the German Consulate General at Calcutta; and regarding the appointment of German Officers as attachés to the German Consulate General at Calcutta.
